member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.QuirkSettings
member.summary: This can be used to add settings that allow react-native-windows behavior to be maintained across version updates to facilitate upgrades. Settings in this class are likely to be removed in future releases, so apps should try to update their code to not rely on these settings.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.QuirkSettings.SetAcceptSelfSigned
member.summary: Runtime setting allowing Networking (HTTP, WebSocket) connections to skip certificate validation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.QuirkSettings.SetMatchAndroidAndIOSStretchBehavior
member.summary: Older versions of react-native-windows did not use [Yoga](https://github.com/facebook/yoga)'s legacy stretch behavior. This meant that react-native-windows would layout views slightly differently that in iOS and Android. Set this setting to false to maintain the behavior from react-native-windows <= 0.62.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.QuirkSettings.SetUseLegacyWebSocketModule
member.summary: Transitional setting allowing to use the deprecated LegacyWebSocketModule.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactApplication
member.summary: The ReactApplication is a base application class for use in applications that are entirely written in React Native. When the app launches, the ReactApplication will load the React instance. Use and properties to customize React instance in your application's constructor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactApplication.Host
member.summary: Access to the of your application.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactApplication.InstanceSettings
member.summary: Provides access to your application's . Generally, changes to these settings will not take effect if the React instance is already loaded, unless the React instance is reloaded, so most settings should be set in your application's constructor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactApplication.JavaScriptBundleFile
member.summary: See .

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactApplication.JavaScriptMainModuleName
member.summary: See .

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactApplication.PackageProviders
member.summary: Provides access to the list of IReactPackageProvider's that the instance will use to provide native modules to the application. This can be used to register additional package providers, such as package providers from community modules. See for more information.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactApplication.UseDeveloperSupport
member.summary: Controls whether the developer experience features such as the developer menu and RedBox are enabled. See .

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactApplication..ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactDispatcherHelper
member.summary: Helper methods for the implementation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactDispatcherHelper.JSDispatcherProperty
member.summary: Gets name of the JSDispatcher property for the . Generally you can use to get the value of this property for a specific React instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactDispatcherHelper.UIDispatcherProperty
member.summary: Gets name of the UIDispatcher property for the . Generally you can use to get the value of this property for a specific React instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactDispatcherHelper.UIThreadDispatcher
member.summary: Gets or creates a for the current UI thread. This can be used with to launch a React instance from a non-UI thread. This API must be called from a UI thread. It will return null if called from a non-UI thread.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactDispatcherHelper.CreateSerialDispatcher
member.summary: Creates a new serial dispatcher that uses thread pool to run tasks.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactInstanceSettings
member.summary: Provides settings to create a React instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactInstanceSettings.BundleRootPath
member.summary: Base path used for the location of the bundle.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactInstanceSettings.ByteCodeFileUri
member.summary: Set this to a location the application has write access to in order for bytecode to be successfully cached. See . **Note that currently the byte code generation is not implemented for UWP applications.**

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactInstanceSettings.DebugBundlePath
member.summary: When loading from a bundle server (such as metro), this is the path that will be requested from the server. If this is not provided the value of or is used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactInstanceSettings.DebugHost
member.summary: When using a , or this is the server that will be used to load the bundle from.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactInstanceSettings.DebuggerBreakOnNextLine
member.summary: For direct debugging, controls whether to break on the next line of JavaScript that is executed. This can help debug issues hit early in the JavaScript bundle load. ***Note: this is not supported with the Chakra JS engine which is the currently used JavaScript engine. As a workaround you could add the debugger keyword in the beginning of the bundle.***

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactInstanceSettings.DebuggerPort
member.summary: When is enabled, this controls the port that the JavaScript engine debugger will run on.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactInstanceSettings.EnableByteCodeCaching
member.summary: For JS engines that support bytecode generation, this controls if bytecode should be generated when a JavaScript bundle is first loaded. Subsequent runs of the application should be faster as the JavaScript will be loaded from bytecode instead of the raw JavaScript. must be set to a location the application has write access to in order for the bytecode to be successfully cached. **Note that currently the byte code generation is not implemented for UWP applications.**

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactInstanceSettings.EnableDeveloperMenu
member.summary: This controls whether various developer experience features are available for this instance. In particular the developer menu, and the default RedBox experience.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactInstanceSettings.EnableJITCompilation
member.summary: Flag controlling whether the JavaScript engine uses JIT compilation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactInstanceSettings.JSIEngineOverride
member.summary: The override to be used with the React instance. In order the override to work the Microsoft.ReactNative must be compiled with support of that engine.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactInstanceSettings.JavaScriptBundleFile
member.summary: The name of the JavaScript bundle file to load. This should be a relative path from . The .bundle extension will be appended to the end, when looking for the bundle file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactInstanceSettings.JavaScriptMainModuleName
member.summary: Name of the JavaScript bundle file. If is specified it is used instead.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactInstanceSettings.Notifications
member.summary: Gets a to send notifications between components and the application. Use to access this from native components or view managers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactInstanceSettings.PackageProviders
member.summary: Gets a list of . Add an implementation of to this list to define additional native modules and custom view managers to be included in the React instance. Auto-linking automatically adds to the application's .

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactInstanceSettings.Properties
member.summary: Gets a to share values between components and the application. Use to access this from native components and view managers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactInstanceSettings.RedBoxHandler
member.summary: Provides an extension point to allow custom error handling within the react instance. See for more information.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactInstanceSettings.SourceBundleHost
member.summary: When using a , , or this is the server hostname that will be used to load the bundle from.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactInstanceSettings.SourceBundlePort
member.summary: When using a , , or this is the server port that will be used to load the bundle from.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactInstanceSettings.UIDispatcher
member.summary: Control the main UI dispatcher to be used by the React instance. If the object is initially created on a UI thread, then this will default to that thread. The value provided here will be available to native modules and view managers using

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactInstanceSettings.UseDeveloperSupport
member.summary: This controls whether various developer experience features are available for this instance. In particular, it enables the developer menu, the default RedBox and LogBox experience.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactInstanceSettings.UseDirectDebugger
member.summary: Enables debugging in the JavaScript engine (if supported). For Chakra this enables debugging of the JS runtime directly within the app using Visual Studio -> Attach to process (Script)

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactInstanceSettings.UseFastRefresh
member.summary: Controls whether the instance triggers the hot module reload logic when it first loads the instance. Most edits should be visible within a second or two without the instance having to reload. Non-compatible changes still cause full reloads. See [Fast Refresh](https://reactnative.dev/docs/fast-refresh) for more information on Fast Refresh.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactInstanceSettings.UseLiveReload
member.summary: Enables live reload to load the source bundle from the React Native packager. When the file is saved, the packager will trigger reloading. **For general use this has been replaced by .**

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactInstanceSettings.UseWebDebugger
member.summary: Controls whether the instance JavaScript runs in a remote environment such as within a browser. By default, this is using a browser navigated to http://localhost:8081/debugger-ui served by Metro/Haul. Debugging will start as soon as the react native instance is loaded.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactNativeHost
member.summary: This is the main entry-point to create a React instance. The ReactNativeHost object exists to configure the instance using before it is loaded, as well as enabling control of when to load the instance. Use events to observe instance creation, loading, and destruction.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactNativeHost.InstanceSettings
member.summary: Provides access to this host's to configure the react instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactNativeHost.PackageProviders
member.summary: Provides access to the list of 's that the React instance will use to provide native modules to the application. This can be used to register additional package providers, such as package providers from community modules or other shared libraries.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactNativeHost.FromContext
member.summary: Returns the instance associated with the given .

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactNativeHost.LoadInstance
member.summary: Loads a new React instance. It is an alias for method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactNativeHost.ReloadInstance
member.summary: Unloads the current React instance and loads a new one. The React instance loading creates an instance of the JavaScript engine, and launches the provided JavaScript code bundle. If a React instance is already running in this host, then shuts down the already the running React instance, and loads a new React instance. The React instance lifecycle can be observed with the following events:- The event is raised when the React instance is just created. - The event is raised when the React instance completed loading the JavaScript bundle. - The event is raised when the React instance is destroyed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactNativeHost.UnloadInstance
member.summary: Unloads current React instance. After the React instance is unloaded, all the React resources including the JavaScript engine environment are cleaned up. The React instance destruction can be observed with the event.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactPropertyBagHelper.GetNamespace
member.summary: Gets an atomic for a provided namespaceName. Consider using module name as the namespace for module-specific properties.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactRootView
member.summary: A XAML component that hosts React Native UI elements.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactRootView.ComponentName
member.summary: The name of the root UI component registered in JavaScript with help of the [AppRegistry.registerComponent](https://reactnative.dev/docs/appregistry#registercomponent) method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactRootView.InitialProps
member.summary: The that is used to serialize the main component initial properties.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactRootView.IsPerspectiveEnabled
member.summary: XAML's default projection in 3D is orthographic (all lines are parallel) However React Native's default projection is a one-point perspective. This property enables setting a default perspective projection on the main control to mimic this.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactRootView.ReactNativeHost
member.summary: The associated with the . It must be set to show any React UI elements.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactRootView.ReloadView
member.summary: Reloads the current UI components.

member.summary: This provides access to the default . This can be used to display the default RedBox as part of a custom RedBoxHandler implementation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.XamlHelper.ColorFrom
member.summary: Returns a Color from .

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.XamlUIService
member.summary: Provides access to XAML UI-specific functionality. It provides access to APIs to get a XAML element from a react tag, and to dispatch events to JS components.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.XamlUIService.DispatchEvent
member.summary: Dispatches an event to a JS component.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.XamlUIService.ElementFromReactTag
member.summary: Gets the backing XAML element from a react tag.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.XamlUIService.FromContext
member.summary: Use this method to get access to the associated with the .

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.XamlUIService.GetAccessibleRoot
member.summary: Retrieves accessible FrameworkElement for app.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.XamlUIService.GetIslandWindowHandle
member.summary: Gets the window handle HWND (as an UInt64) used as the XAML Island window for the current React instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.XamlUIService.GetXamlRoot
member.summary: Retrieves XamlRoot for app.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.XamlUIService.SetAccessibleRoot
member.summary: Sets the that will act as the default accessible element for the app. The element must be able to create an automation peer (see ), or have a Landmark property set (see Property). This must be manually provided to the when using XAML Islands to have access to functionality related to accessibility.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.XamlUIService.SetIslandWindowHandle
member.summary: Sets the windowHandle HWND (as an UInt64) to be the XAML Island window for the current React instance. Pass the value returned by IDesktopWindowXamlSourceNative get_WindowHandle.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.XamlUIService.SetXamlRoot
member.summary: Sets the element for the app. This must be manually provided to the object when using XAML Islands so that certain APIs work correctly. For more information, see [Host WinRT XAML Controls in desktop apps (XAML Islands)](https://docs.microsoft.com/windows/apps/desktop/modernize/xaml-islands).

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.IJSValueReader
member.summary:
Forward-only reader for JSON-like streams. It is used to read data sent between native modules and the Microsoft.ReactNative library.
The JSON-like streams are data structures that satisfy the [JSON specification](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8259). The data structure may have objects with name-value pairs and arrays of items. Property values or array items can be of type Null, Object, Array, String, Boolean, or Number. The IJSValueReader treats the Number type as Int64 or Double. See .
When IJSValueReader reads data it must walk the whole tree without skipping any items. For example, if the current value type is Object, one must call to start reading the current object's properties, and if the current type is Array, must be called to start reading the elements in the array. These functions must be called in a loop until they return false, which signifies that there are no more items within the object or array being traversed.
See the for the corresponding writer interface.
The and must be rarely used directly. Use them to create functions that serialize a native type or deserialize into a native type. The rest of application code must use these functions to serialize/deserialize values. The Microsoft.ReactNative.Cxx and Microsoft.ReactNative.Managed projects offer serializer/deserializer functions for many standard types. Use them directly or to define serializer/deserializer functions for your types.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IJSValueReader.ValueType
member.summary: Gets the type of the current value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IJSValueReader.GetBoolean
member.summary: Gets the current Boolean value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IJSValueReader.GetDouble
member.summary: Gets the current Number value as a Double.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IJSValueReader.GetInt64
member.summary: Gets the current Number value as an Int64.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IJSValueReader.GetNextArrayItem
member.summary:
Advances the iterator within the current array to fetch the next array element. The element can then be obtained by calling one of the Get functions.
Returns **true** if the next array item is acquired successfully. Otherwise, it returns **false**, meaning that reading of the JSON-like array is completed.
**Note** - Use to get the type of the array item and other GetXXX methods to read it. - Use method to start reading property value of type Object. - Use method to start reading property value of type Array

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IJSValueReader.GetNextObjectProperty
member.summary:
Advances the iterator within the current object to fetch the next object property. The property value can then be obtained by calling one of the Get functions.
Returns **true** if the next property is acquired successfully. In that case the propertyName is set to the name of the property. Otherwise, it returns **false**, meaning that reading of the JSON-like object is completed.
**Note** - Use to get the type of the property value and other GetXXX methods to read it. - Use method to start reading property value of type Object. - Use method to start reading property value of type Array

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IJSValueReader.GetString
member.summary: Gets the current String value.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.IJSValueWriter
member.summary:
JSON-like stream writer. It is used to write data that is sent between native modules and the Microsoft.ReactNative library.
The JSON-like streams are data structures that satisfy the [JSON specification](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8259). The data structure may have objects with name-value pairs and arrays of items. Property values or array items can be of type Null, Object, Array, String, Boolean, or Number. The IJSValueWriter treats the Number type as Int64 or Double. See .
See the for the corresponding reader interface.
The and must be rarely used directly. Use them to create functions that serialize a native type or deserialize into a native type. The rest of application code must use these functions to serialize/deserialize values. The Microsoft.ReactNative.Cxx and Microsoft.ReactNative.Managed projects offer serializer/deserializer functions for many standard types. Use them directly or to define serializer/deserializer functions for your types.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IJSValueWriter.WriteArrayBegin
member.summary: Starts writing an array.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IJSValueWriter.WriteArrayEnd
member.summary: Completes writing an array.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IJSValueWriter.WriteBoolean
member.summary: Writes a Boolean value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IJSValueWriter.WriteDouble
member.summary: Writes a Number value from a double.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IJSValueWriter.WriteInt64
member.summary: Writes a Number value from an integer.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IJSValueWriter.WriteNull
member.summary: Writes a Null value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IJSValueWriter.WriteObjectBegin
member.summary: Starts writing an Object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IJSValueWriter.WriteObjectEnd
member.summary: Completes writing an object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IJSValueWriter.WritePropertyName
member.summary: Writes a property name within an object. This call should then be followed by writing the value of that property.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IJSValueWriter.WriteString
member.summary: Writes a String value.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.IJsiByteBuffer
member.summary: An experimental API. Do not use it directly. It may be removed or changed in 0.65. Instead, use the JSI API that uses this API internally. See the ExecuteJsi method in JsiApiContext.h of the Microsoft.ReactNative.Cxx shared project, or the examples of the JSI-based TurboModules in the Microsoft.ReactNative.IntegrationTests project. Note that the JSI is defined only for C++ code. We plan to add the .Net support in future.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.IJsiHostObject
member.summary: An experimental API. Do not use it directly. It may be removed or changed in 0.65. Instead, use the JSI API that uses this API internally. See the ExecuteJsi method in JsiApiContext.h of the Microsoft.ReactNative.Cxx shared project, or the examples of the JSI-based TurboModules in the Microsoft.ReactNative.IntegrationTests project. Note that the JSI is defined only for C++ code. We plan to add the .Net support in future.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactContext
member.summary: The IReactContext object is a weak pointer to the React instance. It allows native modules and view managers to communicate with the application, and with other native modules and view managers. Since the is a weak pointer to the React instance, some of its functionality becomes unavailable after the React instance is unloaded. When a React instance is reloaded inside of the , the previous React instance is unloaded and then a new React instance is created with a new . - Use the to share native module's data with other components. - Use the to exchange events with other components. - Use to call JavaScript functions, and to raise JavaScript events. - Use to post asynchronous work in the UI thread. - Use to post asynchronous work in the JavaScript engine thread.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactContext.JSDispatcher
member.summary: Gets the JavaScript engine thread dispatcher. It is a shortcut for the from the property bag.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactContext.JSRuntime
member.summary: Gets the JavaScript runtime for the running React instance. It can be null if Web debugging is used. **Node: do not use this property directly. It is an experimental property that may be removed or changed in version 0.65.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactContext.Notifications
member.summary: Gets shared with the . It can be used to send notifications events between components and the application. All notification subscriptions added to the are automatically removed after the is destroyed. The notification subscriptions added to the are kept as long as the is alive.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactContext.Properties
member.summary: Gets shared with the . It can be used to share values and state between components and the applications.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactContext.SettingsSnapshot
member.summary: Gets the settings snapshot that was used to start the React instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactContext.UIDispatcher
member.summary: Gets the UI thread dispatcher. It is a shortcut for the from the property bag.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactContext.CallJSFunction
member.summary: Calls the JavaScript function named methodName of moduleName with the paramsArgWriter. The paramsArgWriter is a delegate that receives to serialize the method parameters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactContext.DispatchEvent
member.summary: Deprecated property. Use instead. It will be removed in version 0.65.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactContext.EmitJSEvent
member.summary: Emits JavaScript module event eventName for the eventEmitterName with the paramsArgWriter. It is a specialized call where the method name is always emit and the eventName is added to parameters. The paramsArgWriter is a delegate that receives to serialize the event parameters.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactDispatcher
member.summary: IReactDispatcher provides the core threading/task management interface for ensuring that the code execution happens in the right order on the right thread. One primary dispatcher that applications may require is the which provides native modules access to the UI thread associated with this React instance. Another one is the which allows apps to post tasks to the JS engine thread.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactDispatcher.HasThreadAccess
member.summary: true if the dispatcher uses current thread.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactDispatcher.Post
member.summary: Posts a task to the dispatcher. The callback will be called asynchronously on the thread/queue associated with this dispatcher.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactModuleBuilder
member.summary: Builds native module inside of ReactNative code based on the provided meta-data. See [Native Modules](native-modules) for more usage information.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactModuleBuilder.AddConstantProvider
member.summary: Adds a constant provider method to define constants for the native module. See .

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactModuleBuilder.AddInitializer
member.summary: Adds an initializer method called on the native module initialization. It provides the native module with the for the running ReactNative instance. See . There can be multiple initializer methods which are called in the order they were registered.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactModuleBuilder.AddMethod
member.summary: Adds an asynchronous method to the native module. See .

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactModuleBuilder.AddSyncMethod
member.summary: Adds a synchronous method to the native module. See .

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactNonAbiValue
member.summary: The IReactNonAbiValue helps wrapping a non-ABI-safe C++ value into an IInspectable object. Use it to handle native module lifetime. It also can be used to store values in the that do not need to go through the EXE/DLL boundary.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactNonAbiValue.GetPtr
member.summary: Gets a pointer to the stored value.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactNotificationArgs
member.summary: Notification args provided to the notification handler.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactNotificationArgs.Data
member.summary: The data sent with the notification. It can be any WinRT type. Consider using for sending semi-structured data. It can be null if the notification has no data associated with it.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactNotificationArgs.Subscription
member.summary: The notification subscription that can be used to unsubscribe in the notification handler. It also has the name and dispatcher associated with the notification.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactNotificationService
member.summary: The notification service that can be used to send notifications between different components in an app. Use the method to subscribe to notifications and the method to send notifications.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactNotificationService.SendNotification
member.summary: Sends the notification with notificationName. - notificationName is the name of the notification to send. It must not be null. - sender is the object that sends notification. It can be null. - data is the data associated with the notification. It can be null. Consider using for sending semi-structured data. It can be created using the method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactNotificationService.Subscribe
member.summary: Subscribes to a notification. - notificationName is a non-null notification name that can belong to a specific namespace like any . - dispatcher is used to call notification handlers. If it is null, then the handler is called synchronously. - handler is a delegate that can be implemented as a lambda to handle notifications. The method returns a that must be kept alive while the subscription is active. The subscription is removed when the is destroyed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactNotificationSubscription
member.summary: A subscription to a notification. The subscription is removed when this object is deleted or the method is called.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactNotificationSubscription.Dispatcher
member.summary: The that was provided when the notification subscription was created. All notifications for this subscription will be handled using this dispatcher. If the dispatcher is null, then the events are handled synchronously.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactNotificationSubscription.IsSubscribed
member.summary: True if the subscription is still active. This property is checked internally before the notification handler is invoked.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactNotificationSubscription.NotificationName
member.summary: Name of the notification.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactNotificationSubscription.NotificationService
member.summary: The notification service for the subscription. It can be null if is true and the notification service was already deleted.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactNotificationSubscription.Unsubscribe
member.summary: Removes the subscription. Because of the multi-threaded nature of the notifications, the handler can be still called after the method has been called if the property has already been checked. Consider calling the method and the handler in the same to ensure that no handler is invoked after the method call.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactPackageBuilder
member.summary: Builds ReactNative package with the set of native modules and view managers.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactPackageBuilder.AddModule
member.summary: Adds a custom native module. See .

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactPackageBuilder.AddViewManager
member.summary: Adds a custom view manager. See .

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactPackageBuilderExperimental
member.summary: Experimental extensions to the .

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactPackageBuilderExperimental.AddTurboModule
member.summary: Adds a custom TurboModule that directly uses the JS Engine API (JSI).

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactPackageProvider
member.summary: Implement this interface to provide custom native modules and view managers.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactPackageProvider.CreatePackage
member.summary: Creates a new package with help of the . Use the to register custom native modules and view managers.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactPropertyBag
member.summary: IReactPropertyBag provides a thread-safe property storage. Properties are identified by an instance of . It is expected that there will be no direct use of this interface. Ideally, all usage should happen through strongly-typed accessors.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactPropertyBag.Get
member.summary: Gets value of the name property. It returns null if the property does not exist.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactPropertyBag.GetOrCreate
member.summary: Gets or creates value of the name property. If the property exists, then the method returns its value. If the property does not exist, then this method creates it by calling the createValue delegate. The function may return null if the createValue returns null when called. The createValue is called outside of any locks. It is possible that createValue result is not used when another thread sets the property value before the created value is stored.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactPropertyBag.Set
member.summary: Sets property name to value. It returns the previously-stored property value. It returns null if the property did not exist. If the new value is null, then the property is removed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactPropertyName
member.summary: A name for a property. Use to get atomic property name for a string in a . Each object has a unique in context of the

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactPropertyName.LocalName
member.summary: Gets String representation of the .

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactPropertyName.Namespace
member.summary: Gets the where the property name is defined.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactPropertyNamespace
member.summary: A namespace for a property name. Use to get atomic property namespace for a string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactPropertyNamespace.NamespaceName
member.summary: Gets String representation of the .

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactSettingsSnapshot
member.summary: An immutable snapshot of the used to create the current React instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactSettingsSnapshot.BundleRootPath
member.summary: A read-only snapshot of the property value at the time when the React instance was created. Base path used for the location of the bundle.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactSettingsSnapshot.DebugBundlePath
member.summary: A read-only snapshot of the property value at the time when the React instance was created. When loading from a bundle server (such as metro), this is the path that will be requested from the server.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactSettingsSnapshot.DebuggerBreakOnNextLine
member.summary: A read-only snapshot of the property value at the time when the React instance was created. For direct debugging, controls whether to break on the next line of JavaScript that is executed. This can help debug issues hit early in the JavaScript bundle load. ***Note: this is not supported with the Chakra JS engine which is the currently used JavaScript engine. As a workaround you could add the debugger keyword in the beginning of the bundle.***

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactSettingsSnapshot.DebuggerPort
member.summary: A read-only snapshot of the property value at the time when the React instance was created. When is enabled, this controls the port that the JavaScript engine debugger will run on.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactSettingsSnapshot.JavaScriptBundleFile
member.summary: A read-only snapshot of the property value at the time when the React instance was created. The name of the JavaScript bundle file to load. This should be a relative path from . The .bundle extension will be appended to the end, when looking for the bundle file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactSettingsSnapshot.SourceBundleHost
member.summary: A read-only snapshot of the property value at the time when the React instance was created. When using a , , or this is the server hostname that will be used to load the bundle from.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactSettingsSnapshot.SourceBundlePort
member.summary: A read-only snapshot of the property value at the time when the React instance was created. When using a , , or this is the server port that will be used to load the bundle from.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactSettingsSnapshot.UseDirectDebugger
member.summary: A read-only snapshot of the property value at the time when the React instance was created. Enables debugging in the JavaScript engine (if supported). For Chakra this enables debugging of the JS runtime directly within the app using Visual Studio -> Attach to process (Script)

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactSettingsSnapshot.UseFastRefresh
member.summary: A read-only snapshot of the property value at the time when the React instance was created. Controls whether the instance triggers the hot module reload logic when it first loads the instance. Most edits should be visible within a second or two without the instance having to reload. Non-compatible changes still cause full reloads. See [Fast Refresh](https://reactnative.dev/docs/fast-refresh) for more information on Fast Refresh.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IReactSettingsSnapshot.UseWebDebugger
member.summary: A read-only snapshot of the property value at the time when the React instance was created. Controls whether the instance JavaScript runs in a remote environment such as within a browser. By default, this is using a browser navigated to http://localhost:8081/debugger-ui served by Metro/Haul. Debugging will start as soon as the react native instance is loaded.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.IRedBoxErrorFrameInfo
member.summary: This object represents a single frame within the call stack of an error.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IRedBoxErrorFrameInfo.Collapse
member.summary: True if this frame is part of the internals of react-native, that is likely not useful for the developer to see.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IRedBoxErrorFrameInfo.Column
member.summary: The column within the line.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IRedBoxErrorFrameInfo.File
member.summary: The file location of this frame.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IRedBoxErrorFrameInfo.Line
member.summary: The line number within the file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IRedBoxErrorFrameInfo.Method
member.summary: The method name of this frame.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.IRedBoxErrorInfo
member.summary: This object provides information about the error. For JavaScript errors, a call stack is also provided.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IRedBoxErrorInfo.Callstack
member.summary: For JavaScript errors, this will contain the call stack of where the error occurred.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IRedBoxErrorInfo.ComponentStack
member.summary: This will contain the component stack where the error occurred, which can help identify the component that is producing the error.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IRedBoxErrorInfo.ExtraData
member.summary: Provides access to extra data attached to the error. Adding additional data to the errors is not yet part of the stable API.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IRedBoxErrorInfo.Id
member.summary: This Id can be used in to identify which error is being updated. For native errors, this is currently always 0, and will never be called.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IRedBoxErrorInfo.Message
member.summary: The error message.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IRedBoxErrorInfo.Name
member.summary: An identifier for this error.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IRedBoxErrorInfo.OriginalMessage
member.summary: If the message was adjusted for formatting, or otherwise processed, this contains the message before those modifications.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.IRedBoxHandler
P:Microsoft.ReactNative.IRedBoxHandler.IsDevSupportEnabled
member.summary: This property will control if errors should be reported to the handler. If this returns false, and will not be called.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IRedBoxHandler.ShowNewError
member.summary: This method is called when an error is initially hit.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ReactNative.IRedBoxHandler.UpdateError
member.summary: This method is called when updated information about an error has been resolved. For JavaScript errors, this is called if source map information was able to be resolved to provide a more useful call stack.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.IViewManager
member.summary: See the documentation of [Native UI Components](view-managers) for information on how to author a view manager. >**This documentation and the underlying platform code is a work in progress.**

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.IViewManagerCreateWithProperties
member.summary: Enables a view manager to create views whose behavior depend on the the property values passed to the view manager at creation time. For example, a view manager could choose to create different types of UI elements based on the properties passed in.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.IViewManagerRequiresNativeLayout
member.summary: Enables a view manager to be responsible for its own layout and sizing.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.DesktopWindowMessage
member.summary: Represents a window message. See https://docs.microsoft.com/windows/win32/learnwin32/window-messages

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.JsiObjectRef
member.summary: An experimental API. Do not use it directly. It may be removed or changed in 0.65. Instead, use the JSI API that uses this API internally. See the ExecuteJsi method in JsiApiContext.h of the Microsoft.ReactNative.Cxx shared project, or the examples of the JSI-based TurboModules in the Microsoft.ReactNative.IntegrationTests project. Note that the JSI is defined only for C++ code. We plan to add the .Net support in future.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.JsiPropertyIdRef
member.summary: An experimental API. Do not use it directly. It may be removed or changed in 0.65. Instead, use the JSI API that uses this API internally. See the ExecuteJsi method in JsiApiContext.h of the Microsoft.ReactNative.Cxx shared project, or the examples of the JSI-based TurboModules in the Microsoft.ReactNative.IntegrationTests project. Note that the JSI is defined only for C++ code. We plan to add the .Net support in future.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.ConstantProviderDelegate
member.summary: A delegate to gather constants for the native module.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.InitializerDelegate
member.summary: A delegate that sets reactContext for a module. We use it for a stand-alone initialize method, strongly typed JS events and functions. Experimental code uses it to initialize TurboModule CallInvoker.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.JSValueArgWriter
member.summary: The JSValueArgWriter delegate is used to pass values to ABI API. In a function that implements the delegate use the provided writer to stream custom values.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.JsiByteArrayUser
member.summary: An experimental API. Do not use it directly. It may be removed or changed in 0.65. Instead, use the JSI API that uses this API internally. See the ExecuteJsi method in JsiApiContext.h of the Microsoft.ReactNative.Cxx shared project, or the examples of the JSI-based TurboModules in the Microsoft.ReactNative.IntegrationTests project. Note that the JSI is defined only for C++ code. We plan to add the .Net support in future.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.JsiHostFunction
member.summary: An experimental API. Do not use it directly. It may be removed or changed in 0.65. Instead, use the JSI API that uses this API internally. See the ExecuteJsi method in JsiApiContext.h of the Microsoft.ReactNative.Cxx shared project, or the examples of the JSI-based TurboModules in the Microsoft.ReactNative.IntegrationTests project. Note that the JSI is defined only for C++ code. We plan to add the .Net support in future.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.MethodDelegate
member.summary: A delegate to call native asynchronous method.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.MethodResultCallback
member.summary: A callback to call JS code with results.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactCreatePropertyValue
member.summary: This delegate is used to create a property value on-demand.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactDispatcherCallback
member.summary: The delegate is used to create property value on-demand.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactModuleProvider
member.summary: Provides information about a custom native module. See .

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactNotificationHandler
member.summary: Delegate to handle notifications. - The sender parameter is the object that sent the notification. It can be null. - The args contain the notification-specific data and the notification subscription.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.ReactViewManagerProvider
member.summary: Provides information about a custom view manager. See .

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReactNative.SyncMethodDelegate
member.summary: A delegate to call native synchronous method.
